Class GemPuzzleLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • GemPuzzleLogic

  • public class GemPuzzleLogic
extends java.lang.Object

    This class contains the back-end logic for the GUI in class GemPuzzle .

    For a general description of the game please refer to: Gem Puzzle

    Version:
    2.0, 12/19/17
    Author:
    John Doe
    See Also:
    GemPuzzle

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static int[][] init​(int rows,
                           int cols)

        Creates an initial game board for gem puzzles of size rows x cols.

        The game board is encoded as a two-dimensional array (matrix) of int-values, where 0 denotes the free (spare) field!

        The matrix is organised in rows, i.e. matrix[0][1] denotes the field in the top row (0) and second column from left (1). Initially and when solved, matrix[0][1] must have value 2.

        The free (spare) field with value 0 must be the "last" one in the lower right corner. All other values must be aligned and sorted as if read from top/left to bottom/right.

        Example:

        matrix[?][0] matrix[?][1] matrix[?][2]
        matrix[0][?]: 1 2 3
        matrix[1][?]: 4 5 6
        matrix[2][?]: 7 8 0
        Parameters:
        rows - the number of rows in the gem puzzle
        cols - the number of columns in the gem puzzle
        Returns:
        a rectangular two-dimensional array of ints containing the values of the initial (i.e. solved) gem puzzle fields

      • shuffle

        public static void shuffle​(int[][] matrix)

        Swaps the free (spare) field with exactly one randomly chosen neighbouring field.

        The neighbouring field must be immediately at the left, right, above or below position of the spare field - but never at a diagonal position.

        Parameters:
        matrix - a rectangular two-dimensional array of ints representing a gem puzzle containing exactly one free (spare) field denoted by value 0 somewhere

      • isGameOver

        public static boolean isGameOver​(int[][] matrix)

        Checks if the matrix represents a solved gem puzzle.

        A gem puzzle is solved, if and only if the free (spare) field denoted by value 0 is the last one, i.e. in the lower right corner, and all other values are aligned (sorted) as if read from top/left to bottom/right. An example is shown in the description of the method init(int, int) .

        Parameters:
        matrix - a rectangular two-dimensional array of ints representing a gem puzzle containing exactly one free (spare) field denoted by value 0 somewhere
        Returns:
        true, if the gem puzzle is solved and false otherwise
        See Also:
        init(int, int)

      • moveGap

        public static boolean moveGap​(int[][] matrix,
                              Direction direction)

        Moves the free (spare) field into the requested direction, if possible.

        Whenever the player hits one of the arrow keys (cursor keys), this method is called by GemPuzzle with the current gem puzzle matrix and the direction corresponding to the arrow key.

        This method must check, whether the move is legal: If the gem puzzle is solved or the move cannot be accomplished (e.g. because the spare field would have to leave the game board), this method does nothing and returns false immediately. In all other cases, the method swaps the spare field with the neighbouring field at the position denoted by direction and returns true.

        Parameters:
        matrix - a rectangular two-dimensional array of ints representing a gem puzzle containing exactly one free (spare) field denoted by value 0 somewhere
        direction - the direction into which the free (spare) field should be moved
        Returns:
        true, if the move could be accomplished and false otherwise
        See Also:
        Direction, GemPuzzle

      • autoComplete

        public static Direction[] autoComplete​(int[][] matrix)
        Solves the gem puzzle with the least number of moves.
        Parameters:
        matrix - a rectangular two-dimensional array of ints representing a gem puzzle containing exactly one free (spare) field denoted by value 0 somewhere
        Returns:
        array of Directions to move the free (spare) field in order to solve the puzzle - if no solution exists, the resulting array contains no element (has length 0)
        See Also:
        Direction
